Back in the Spring, an awesome female student in my chess club asked could we include Alice in Wonderland as one of the sets. So I did some searching, and embarked on an "Etsy" journey and found this phenomenal set.

It is imperative to inspire and support young women to compete in strategy games, especially when it comes to male-dominated ones. The unspoken and biased cultural definition of chess as the "smart man's game" or "only a genius can master chess strategies" often times turns girls AND adult women away from even just attempting to try the game-which is crazy considering the strongest piece in the game is the Queen!!! 👸 Teach Queens to Checkmate! #AliceInWonderland #Femalechessplayers #schoolchessclub #number6 #VIIKingdomsChess

Northampton County Schools is sharing this information shared by the UNC Board of Governors to NCDPI’s Accountability Division.

Please note, this policy update does not remove the ACT as an accountability indicator for the 2020-21 school year.

Due to the impact of COVID-19 on testing availability and the likelihood of additional cancellations, the UNC Board of Governors waived the standardized test requirement for first-year students applying for admission in Spring 2021, Summer 2021, and Fall 2021.

Students have the option to submit test scores to the 16 public universities in the UNC System, but test scores will not be required for admissions decisions. Students who do not submit an ACT or SAT test score must meet the minimum weighted GPA requirement of 2.5 to be considered for undergraduate admissions.
